disease: Reconstruction of the Bladder and Bladder Outlet

mcqs.question: A newborn male presents with an exposed bladder plate on the lower abdomen. Which of the following best describes this condition?

options.A: A spectrum of congenital malformations due to midline closure failure of abdominal wall structures
options.B: An acquired inflammatory condition of the bladder mucosa
options.C: A renal disorder causing secondary bladder changes
options.D: A neurological condition affecting bladder innervation

mcqs.explanation: Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex is defined as a spectrum of congenital malformations characterized by a failure of the abdominal wall and underlying structures to close in the midline, resulting in an open bladder plate exposed on the lower abdomen.

mcqs.question: What is believed to be the etiology of Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex?

options.A: A failure of the cloacal membrane to be reinforced by mesoderm during gestation
options.B: A genetic mutation inherited in an autosomal dominant pattern

mcqs.explanation: The exact cause is unknown but is believed to be a failure of the cloacal membrane to be reinforced by mesoderm during the 4th to 10th week of gestation, leading to its premature rupture.

mcqs.question: What happens to the exposed bladder mucosa in untreated Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex?

options.A: It becomes chronically inflamed, fibrotic, and polypoid

mcqs.explanation: The exposed bladder mucosa becomes chronically inflamed, fibrotic, and polypoid in Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex.

mcqs.question: A 3-month-old male with bladder exstrophy-epispadias complex is being evaluated. Which of the following associated conditions is most likely to be present?
mcqs.explanation: Inguinal hernias occur in >80% of males with Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex due to wide inguinal rings and lack of obliquity of the inguinal canal.

mcqs.question: What is the primary goal of the initial bladder closure in Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex?

options.A: Secure closure of the abdominal wall and bladder without tension

mcqs.explanation: The goal of primary bladder closure is to secure closure of the abdominal wall and bladder without tension.

mcqs.question: What is the success rate for initial bladder closure in Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex when performed with osteotomy at a high-volume center?
mcqs.explanation: When performed at a high-volume center with osteotomy, the success rate for initial closure is >90%.

mcqs.question: What preoperative bladder capacity is a significant predictor of success for bladder neck reconstruction in Bladder Exstrophy-Epispadias Complex?
mcqs.explanation: A significant predictor of success for bladder neck reconstruction is a preoperative bladder capacity of >85 mL.

mcqs.question: What is the definition of Posterior Urethral Valves (PUV)?

options.A: A congenital obstructive membrane in the posterior male urethra causing bladder outlet obstruction
options.C: A inflammatory polyp in the bladder
options.D: A traumatic injury to the urethra

mcqs.explanation: Posterior Urethral Valves is defined as a congenital obstructive membrane in the posterior male urethra (verumontanum) causing varying degrees of bladder outlet obstruction.

mcqs.question: What effect do Posterior Urethral Valves have on the bladder?

options.A: Cause a thick-walled, hypertrophied bladder with poor compliance
options.B: Lead to bladder atrophy and shrinkage
options.C: Result in a normal bladder appearance

mcqs.explanation: Posterior Urethral Valves cause elevated voiding pressures, leading to a thick-walled, hypertrophied bladder with poor compliance (valve bladder syndrome).

mcqs.question: What is the success rate of endoscopic valve ablation as the primary treatment for Posterior Urethral Valves?
mcqs.explanation: Endoscopic valve ablation is definitive treatment in >90% of cases of Posterior Urethral Valves.

mcqs.question: What is essential for bladder emptying after augmentation cystoplasty or outlet procedures in Posterior Urethral Valves?
mcqs.explanation: Clean intermittent catheterization is essential for bladder emptying after augmentation or outlet procedures in Posterior Urethral Valves.
